parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> An SQF version of C++ [http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstring/strtok/ strtok]. Splits given ANSI string ''str'' into an array of tokens according to given ''delimiters''. In addition, if empty string "" is used for ''delimiters'', ''str'' is split by each character. If Unicode support is desired, see [[forceUnicode]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> str '''splitString''' delimiters

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> str: [[String]] - A string to split
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> delimiters: [[String]] - one or more characters, each used as a separate delimiter.
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_str = "- This, is a sample string." [[splitString]] "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"]
_str [[joinString]] " "; // "This is a sample string"</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>"\A3\ui_f\data\map\vehicleicons\iconLogic_ca.paa" [[splitString]] "\."; 
// ["A3","ui_f","data","map","vehicleicons","iconLogic_ca","paa"]</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>"1:2:3" [[splitString]] ":"; // ["1","2","3"]</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code>"Japa is the best!" [[splitString]] "" [[joinString]] " "; // "J a p a   i s   t h e   b e s t !"</code>

</value></part><part><name>x5</name>=<value> <code>_cmd = [[currentMagazineDetail]] [[player]]; //"9mm 16Rnd Mag(13/16)[id/cr:10000011/0]"
_cmd [[splitString]] "([ ]/:)"; //["9mm","16Rnd","Mag","13","16","id","cr","10000011","0"]</code>

</value></part><part><name>x7</name>=<value> Remove all \r\n from file:<code>[[loadFile]] "somefile.txt" [[splitString]] [[toString]] [13,10] [[joinString]] " "</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[joinString]], [[set]], [[resize]], [[reverse]], [[select]], [[in]], [[find]], [[toArray]], [[forEach]], [[count]], [[deleteAt]], [[deleteRange]], [[append]], [[sort]], [[param]], [[params]], [[arrayIntersect]], [[toString]], [[endl]], [[forceUnicode]], [http://www.utf8-chartable.de/ Unicode Character Table]
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 17, 2016 - 14:18 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:BaerMitUmlaut|BaerMitUmlaut]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command is unreliable/broken when it comes to some non-ASCII characters (as of Arma 3 1.58):
<code>"Mörser" splitString ""
-> ["M"," "," ","r","s","e","r"]
"Mörser" splitString "ö"
-> ["M","rser"]
"Mörser" splitString "ä"
-> ["M"," rser"]</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 17, 2016 - 14:03 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note"> This commands works only with ASCII chars, any chars with codes > 127, also used in different languages, will be converted to [" ", " "]. Use [[toArray]] to preserve special characters:
<code>_spaced = [[toArray]] "Mörser" [[apply]] {[[toString]] [_x]} [[joinString]] " "; // M ö r s e r</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 19, 2019 - 11:17 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:R3vo|R3vo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When working with string which contain linebreaks...
<code>"stringWith" + [[endl]] + "Linebreak" [[splitString]] ",; "; //Result ["someStringWith
Linebreak"]</code>

...one can remove those by adding [[endl]] as delimiter
<code>"stringWith" + [[endl]] + "Linebreak" [[splitString]] ",; " + [[endl]] //Result ["someStringWith","Linebreak"]</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
